summary: This is a sealed application and supporting affidavit filed by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, seeking warrants and orders for prospective/historical location data and pen register information for two cellphones believed to be used by Ghislaine Maxwell. The filing is made in conjunction with a June 29, 2020 indictment and arrest warrant for Maxwell, and aims to locate her for arrest.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signs the application as the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, requesting the court to issue warrants for cellphone location and pen register information.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The primary target of the investigation and warrants; indicted on charges including conspiracy to entice minors, transportation of minors, and perjury; believed to use the two target cellphones.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a close associate and employer of Ghislaine Maxwell; his phone, seized upon arrest, contained a contact for one of the target cellphones under the name 'Ghislaine'.

persons.name: Lisa Margaret Smith
persons.context: Signed the arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell on June 29, 2020.

persons.name: Joshua Perry
persons.context: Husband of a former Epstein employee; his phone was in contact with one of the target cellphones as recently as May 2020.

persons.name: Isabel Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell's sister; her phone was in contact with both target cellphones.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: An attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell in civil litigation; her phone was in contact with both target cellphones.

persons.name: Scott Borgerson
persons.context: An individual with whom Ghislaine Maxwell shares a joint bank account and to whom her Amazon account has sent packages; his phone was in contact with both target cellphones.

persons.name: Amanda Youna
persons.context: The affiant who submitted the supporting affidavit detailing the investigation and basis for the warrant requests.

persons.name: Katharine H. Parker
persons.context: The magistrate judge before whom the agent's affidavit was sworn.

connections.description: Described as close associate and employee; charged with committing subject offenses together.
Isabel Maxwell is identified as Ghislaine Maxwell's sister.
Laura Menninger is identified as an attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell in civil litigation.
They share a joint bank account and her Amazon account has sent multiple packages to him.
Phone contact; Joshua Perry is the husband of a former Epstein employee.

events.title: Indictment and Arrest Warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell with conspiracy to entice minors, transportation of minors, and perjury. Magistrate Judge Lisa Margaret Smith signed a warrant for her arrest.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI on federal sex trafficking charges. An iPhone was seized from his possession.

events.title: Application for Cellphone Tracking Warrants
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office filed a sealed application seeking warrants for prospective/historical location data and pen register info for two cellphones linked to Ghislaine Maxwell to locate her for arrest.

keyFacts: The document is a sealed application from June 29, 2020, seeking court orders to track two cellphones (numbers 917-520-3106 and 978-525-8484) to locate Ghislaine Maxwell for arrest.
Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted the same day on charges including conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts, transporting minors, and perjury.
One target phone was subscribed to 'Terramar Project, Inc.', an organization founded by Maxwell, and was saved as a contact named 'Ghislaine' in Jeffrey Epstein's seized iPhone.

The affidavit details phone contacts between the target numbers and individuals including Maxwell's sister Isabel, her attorney Laura Menninger, associate Scott Borgerson, and Joshua Perry (husband of a former Epstein employee).

The government requested a non-disclosure order to prevent the service providers (T-Mobile and AT&T) from notifying the subscribers about the warrants for one year, citing risks of flight, evidence destruction, and witness intimidation.
